intro: Viguiera reflexa, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while its flowers range from white to pink, adding ornamental value to gardens. Viguiera reflexa is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
